Awareness.description: Make more people aware of your business, product, or brand.

strategies.description: Sending highly localized email campaigns based on the physical location of the business.
strategies.example: We are your local partner for [service], just around the corner in [city].

strategies.description: Promoting the visibility of a business in local search results and business directories.
strategies.example: We can help you rank higher in local searches on Google Maps.

strategies.description: Leveraging local events or holidays to drive awareness.
strategies.example: Launch a Black Friday sale to boost revenue and customer acquisition.

strategies.description: Promoting local business networking events or webinars.
strategies.example: Join us for a local business networking event in [city].

questions: Who is our ideal audience, and where do they spend their time?
What channels are best for reaching our target audience?
What’s our unique selling proposition (USP) that should stand out?
How many people should we aim to reach?
Are there specific events or trends we can leverage?
examples: Increase website traffic by 50% in the next 3 months.
Reach 100,000 impressions on social media within 2 months.
Grow brand mentions by 25% through influencer partnerships.

Consideration.description: Engage potential customers and encourage them to learn more.

strategies.description: Ongoing, automated email sequences designed to nurture leads through educational content.
strategies.example: Download our latest e-book on how small businesses in [city] can grow through digital marketing.

strategies.description: A sequence of emails that deliver valuable content over time to keep the business engaged.
strategies.example: Here’s your monthly digital marketing tip for [industry].

strategies.description: Hosting webinars that educate local businesses on relevant industry trends or challenges.
strategies.example: Join our free webinar on boosting local SEO for small businesses.

strategies.description: Using social proof by sharing success stories or testimonials from local businesses in email campaigns.
strategies.example: See how [local business] used our services to increase their local customer base by 30%.

questions: What pain points are we solving for our audience?
How can we educate prospects about our product’s benefits?
What content formats (blogs, videos, webinars) will best address their needs?
How will we demonstrate credibility (e.g., case studies, testimonials)?
What’s the next step we want prospects to take?
examples: Increase email sign-ups by 30% using educational lead magnets.
Achieve a 20% growth in webinar registrations within 6 months.
Improve product demo requests by 15% through retargeting ads.

Conversion.description: Drive specific actions like purchases, sign-ups, or bookings.

strategies.type: Cold Email Outreach for Lead Generation
strategies.description: Sending introductory emails to businesses that haven't previously interacted with your brand.
strategies.example: We’ve helped businesses like yours in [location] improve their local presence—can we schedule a call?

strategies.description: Providing exclusive discounts or promotions tailored to the local business community.
strategies.example: Get 20% off our digital marketing services for businesses in [city]!

strategies.description: Targeting existing or previous customers with additional services or upgraded packages.
strategies.example: As a valued customer, we’d like to offer you an exclusive deal on our advanced local SEO package.

strategies.description: Highlighting the benefits of your service compared to local competitors to attract new clients.
strategies.example: Switch from [competitor] and see how our personalized service can drive better results for your business.

questions: What specific actions do we want customers to take?
Are there barriers in the customer journey preventing conversions?
What offers or incentives can encourage immediate action?
How can we reduce cart abandonment rates?
What is a realistic conversion rate for our business?
examples: Achieve a 10% increase in sales from paid ads in the next quarter.
Boost landing page conversions to 20% by optimizing CTAs.
Generate 1,000 new subscriptions through a limited-time discount.

Retention.description: Keep existing customers engaged and loyal.

strategies.description: Rewarding businesses that engage with your services frequently or refer other companies.
strategies.example: Join our loyalty program—get exclusive discounts after every five purchases with us.

strategies.description: Targeting businesses that haven't responded or interacted for a while to rekindle their interest.
strategies.example: We noticed you haven’t tried our latest services—here’s a special offer just for you.

strategies.type: Feedback and Surveys for Continuous Improvement
strategies.description: Gathering feedback from customers to improve services and foster deeper connections.
strategies.example: How can we improve? Share your thoughts in our quick survey, and help us serve local businesses better.

questions: What drives customer satisfaction for our business?
What common issues lead to churn, and how can we address them?
How can we re-engage inactive customers?
What additional value can we provide to increase loyalty?
Are there opportunities for recurring purchases or subscriptions?
examples: Reduce customer churn by 10% in 6 months through better onboarding.
Increase repeat purchases by 15% using email reminders.
Boost Net Promoter Score (NPS) to 8+ by improving customer support.

Advocacy.description: Turn customers into brand ambassadors who promote your business.

strategies.description: Using social proof by sharing success stories or testimonials from local businesses in email campaigns.
strategies.example: See how [local business] used our services to increase their local customer base by 30%.

strategies.description: Encouraging clients to refer others in their network by offering incentives.
strategies.example: Refer a business in your area and get a 15% discount on your next purchase.

strategies.description: Partnering with other local businesses to cross-promote services to each other's clients.
strategies.example: Partner with us to co-promote our services and grow your network in [location].

questions: How can we encourage customers to leave reviews or testimonials?
What incentives can we provide for referrals?
How can we engage satisfied customers to share their experiences?
What content or programs can inspire customers to promote us?
examples: Get 50 new customer reviews on Google within 3 months.
Launch a referral program to acquire 100 new customers in Q1.
Increase user-generated content (UGC) mentions by 25% on Instagram.

Product-Specific.description: Align marketing with the product’s specific needs (e.g., launching a new feature).

strategies.description: Encouraging early adopters to test new features or products in exchange for feedback.
strategies.example: Join our beta program and get early access to our upcoming product updates.

strategies.description: A series of emails to educate users about a specific product feature or update.
strategies.example: Learn how to maximize your ROI with our latest analytics dashboard feature.

questions: What features need promotion, and to whom?
How can we position the product as a solution to specific pain points?
What KPIs should we track for product usage or adoption?
Are there new markets we need to penetrate?
examples: Achieve 5,000 sign-ups for a beta program within 6 weeks.
Promote new feature adoption to 40% of existing users.
Generate 1,500 new customers for a premium product tier.

Channel-Specific.description: Optimize marketing efforts on individual channels.

strategies.description: Collaborating with influencers who align with our brand and target audience.
strategies.example: Partner with [influencer] to promote our services to their audience.

strategies.description: Tailoring campaigns to specific platforms like LinkedIn, Instagram, or YouTube.
strategies.example: Boost engagement on Instagram with a series of reels showcasing our latest product.

questions: What channels are performing best for us?
Are there new channels we should explore?
What type of content resonates most with our audience on each platform?
How can we optimize underperforming channels?
examples: Grow LinkedIn followers by 10,000 in Q1.
Increase Instagram engagement rate to 5% within 3 months.
Boost YouTube video views to 50,000 for the next product launch.

Seasonal.description: Leverage events, holidays, or limited-time offers.

strategies.description: Creating campaigns around specific events or holidays to drive sales or sign-ups.
strategies.example: Launch a Black Friday sale to boost revenue and customer acquisition.

questions: Are there any upcoming holidays or events we can target?
What type of seasonal offers resonate with our audience?
How can we maximize urgency for a campaign?
What metrics will define the success of the campaign?
examples: Generate $50,000 in revenue from Black Friday promotions.
Achieve 25% more sign-ups during a summer sale campaign.

Competitive.description: Improve market positioning relative to competitors.

strategies.description: Analyzing competitors' strategies and market positioning to inform our own.
strategies.example: We’ve outperformed [competitor] in [metric] by 20% this quarter.

questions: How does our product/service compare to competitors?
Are there gaps in the market that we can fill?
What areas are competitors outperforming us in?
How can we showcase differentiation?
examples: Increase share of voice (SOV) by 15% in industry-related keywords.
Capture 20% of competitor’s customer base using a targeted campaign.
Outperform competitor’s ad engagement rates by 25%.

Revenue.description: Tie marketing efforts directly to business revenue or profitability.

strategies.description: Aligning marketing spend with revenue goals to maximize ROI.
strategies.example: We’ve achieved a 5x return on ad spend (ROAS) for digital ads this quarter.

strategies.description: Prioritizing and targeting leads with the highest potential revenue impact.
strategies.example: Schedule a demo with high-value leads in [location] for tailored solutions.

questions: How much revenue do we want to generate from marketing efforts?
What’s the target ROI for each campaign?
How can we optimize marketing spend to maximize profitability?
What metrics will define the success of the campaign?
examples: Generate $200,000 in revenue from paid campaigns in Q2.
Achieve a 5x return on ad spend (ROAS) for digital ads.
Reduce cost-per-acquisition (CPA) by 20% through ad optimization.
